Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: SUCKS
Body: So I bought this cream after searching several numbing creams and came across this one and read reviews of how people have used this specific one for tattoos , piercings, etc. I purchased it, in hopes of using it to numb me so I can get nipple piercings. I tried it a day before just to test it out. I applied a generous amount two times within 1 hour and never was numbed.The following day ( day i was ready to get pierced) i tried the product again just to be sure if it worked or not, it still did not work to numb. My friend also tried it on herself and it did not work for her either. So im not sure why it worked for others and we did not get that same experience, but this was a waste of purchase, and time. #VeryUnhappy. #NotSatisfied #SomeoneLied.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021
Author: RJ
Title: False advertisement. Scam. I highly don't recommend. Read full comment
Body: This doesnt work very well at all. Followed the directions but no numbing. Not until you actually tattoo and then apply to the area, does it do any numbing. Was definitely let down by this because its not worth the price. I do NOT recommend. Also the directions they explain on here isn't the same as on the tube. Does NOT numb the area prior to doing a tattoo. Im just thankful i took precautions and tried it on myself before anyone else. I would have had some not too pleased customer just as im not too pleased.Update: They continued to email me asking me to take down my review and credit me half of what I paid... Said if I gave a 5 star and good review, they'd then credit me for the full price. ~BEWARE OF THIS SCAM~ Im not changing my review. This went back and forth a while. So i said I didnt want the money back and that this review will stay. Asked me to lie to get my money back... Thats bad business. PERIOD

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2021
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Doesn’t work
Body: Used this on my chest before being waxed. It doesn’t do anything for me at all. I put a ton of this stuff on my body, numerous times leading up to the appointment. I wrapped in plastic film. Nothing I could do made it work for me.Edit: This company has been borderline harassing and threatening in their attempt to get me to remove this negative review so I came back here to it to reiterate how awful this stuff is, and whoever is running their account can see I am clearly not budging on my position and I cannot be bought with gift cards.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2021
Author: MakesArt
Title: Unbelievably INEFFECTIVE. Does it actually contain any Lidocaine?
Body: Did NOTHING!I receive subcutaneous treatments that involve four or five subcu needles every week, and have done so for a few years. I've used several different lidocaine cream brands, including prescription as well as over the counter creams like aspercreme, which have 4% lidocaine instead of the 5% this is supposed to have. This Base Labs supposed 5% lidocaine cream is the first one I have ever used that does ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. I was really quite surprised at how completely ineffective it is. I feel like it should have a friend over at UCSD chemistry labs running analysis because I don't see how it could contain any lidocaine at all.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2022
Author: roadrunner
Title: takes a while to start working
Body: I was surprised at how long this took to start working....several minutes. It did eventually work. Perhaps it is not absorbed quickly into the skin. I would not buy again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
Author: windycindy
Title: Worthless: Just Bite Your Tongue Instead and Pray.
Body: this product is as "worthless as tits on a bull," a dear friend of mine would say about this product. DO NOT BUY IT IF YOU EXPECT ANY RELIEF FROM YOUR PAIN! I have very real, chronic pain. My pain compromises my ability to work and complete projects. I expect some relief from any lotion or cream touting 5% lidocaine. i have used prescription 4% Lidocaine patches and know that they are very effective. This product should have been more effective than my prescription patches with 1% more Lidocaine. It did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING for me. I smeared it on my back quite heavily and it just lay there like it was hoping for a free lunch at the Waldorf, which never came..

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
Author: Johnny D
Title: Not worth it
Body: This product was not at all what the excellent reviews stated. The tube was opened in the box it came in with no safety seal on the cap or anything to show that this may or may not have been tampered with. There was no texture to the lotion. It was like white water. I still tried a bit of it for a couple days and it did absolutely nothing. Threw it away.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
Author: Soccergurl37Soccergurl37
Title: Already disappointed
Body: Have not tried it yet but one of the main reasons I got it was because it said it had clove oil in it as well which I know from experience is GREAT at naturally numbing something. I just received it and I haven’t even opened it and the first thing I noticed is that it does NOT have clove oil in it. Very upset from that alone. I will update once I have tried it. I am getting a large hip/thigh tattoo in 2 days and am planning on using it for that.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021
Author: Jamie
Title: Waste of money
Body: Did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING for my knee pain OR tattoo. Ad says if it doesn’t work money back, I emailed the seller and was told it could be that the product was “old” and therefore ineffective. Fair enough, was asked what I would like...well I’d like my money back, but no way to reply and now it’s “unavailable “ and now Amazon giving a run around. WASTE OF MONEY

Title: Didn’t work

Author: Summer
Title: DIDNT WORK. Keeps them from doing the ink transfer also
Body: They can’t place stencil or draw one down with this stuff on. And it also didn’t work well at all

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2022
Author: kms10
Title: Doesn’t work
Body: I’m an esthetician. In my previous job we had access to Rx strength combo numbing cream that worked great for microneedling, mild lasers, etc. I’ve since changed jobs and don’t have access to that anymore, so decided to try this one. I tried it on myself first and it does absolutely nothing as far as numbing goes. It smells like and has about as much “numbing” effect as BenGay. I even applied twice, in THICK layers, covered with plastic and let it set for 45 mins but I could still feel even just the light touch of my fingertips. (So obviously the microneedling was then very uncomfortable when normally with the stronger numbing cream I don’t even feel anything.) Don’t waste your money on this.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2022
Author: Amanda Knight
Title: Doesn't Work
Body: Applied this 1 hour before my tattoo appointment, wrapped it up tightly in Saran wrap as one does with numbing creams. No numbing ever occured. We washed it off, waited another hour (my tattoo artist is my best friend and she books the day out to get me in). Nothing happened. So I applied my Zansa numbing cream, which is way more expensive, BUT, I couldn't feel a thing. I was sitting for another 4 hour sesh on my stomach tattoo so I needed this to work, it didn't. I wouldn't purchase this again, and I'll be sending it back.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
Author: Jen
Title: Doesn't work, read the reviews
Body: Wish I had read the other one star reviews before purchasing. While this product smells nice and has a pleasant and easy to use texture it basically is a tube of expensive lotion. This product does not numb at all. I really wanted it to work and gave it multiple tries, eventually testing it in a side by side comparison with another brand of 5% lidocaine cream I use to confirm my suspicions. Hint: the other one worked and this one did not. I used this product as directed: applied the cream and placed a tegaderm plastic patch over the cream. I waited for 30-60 minutes undisturbed for it to take effect. The end result was that even after letting it sit for 60 minutes I could still feel the pain of a tiny insulin needle poking my skin.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
Author: Pen NameGILBERT
Title: Liquid
Body: Purchased this product received it yesterday, was great the only problem is it came out as in liquid this is the reason why I won't purchase it again, Seem like half of the tube came out.

Body: The smell was nice, the cream was soft, but for the purpose of this product… it does NOT numb the skin at all. It just feels minty but doesn’t numb anything. I bought this product for tattoos and micro needling. Won’t buy again.

Body: So I have used this same product before. I reordered before my last supply ran out and it didn't work at all. I used first supply and worked great. Second, absolutely nothing. Don't know what happened. Very disappointed.

Author: Suzy
Title: Ineffective topical
Body: I have fibromyalgia and my pain meds just don't help enough for the pain I'm constantly in. Seeing that this has 5% lidocaine instead of the usual 4% I'm use to seeing in topical I was hopeful that it would help but it didn't seem to have any numbing effect at all so my search for an effective topical isn't over because I still haven't found one that works for me.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021
Author: Telestai
Title: Relief from WHAT??
Body: Spoiler alert: Haven't used it yet; highly insulted [but amused] at the utter LACK of honesty in the glowing descriptions. The tube states CLEARLY that the cream is designed for anorectal pain. . . but ALL of the descriptions/testimonials, which I used while making my selection, refer to pain from tattoos, microblading, lip injections, and other cosmetic procedures. It's called "Base Numb" -- guess, literally, it WOULD numb someone's "base." But the advertising is HIGHLY deceptive.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2022
Author: Kaley Calderon
Title: Doesn’t work
Body: This cream doesn’t work at all. I let it sit in my leg for an hour and I wrapped it before my tattoo apt, and I felt everything. I can handle the tattoo pain but the point is the cream didn’t numb The area at all. Don’t waste your time and money on this product

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021
Author: Dina
Title: terrible
Body: I went for a tattoo today- I prepped with this. It felt like Icy Hot and did not numb my skin AT ALL. This is terrible.  Sat through 4 hours of pain ( I know  tattoos are supposed to hurt) when I should have had some numbness for some of the time. NOTHING not one minute- Just Icy hot on the surface.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2021
Author: casper
Title: waste of money
Body: preparing for a tattoo... I tested on my skin two times and used a straight pin to test the area. both times I felt the needle.  Wish I had not listened to my friend when she said she read the reviews and they were g**d. This was a total waste of money.  I was trying to be careful with my choice of words hoping not to be confused with the use of the word g**d when it's not.

Title: Doesn't work at all!
Body: I purchased this product in hopes of no pain with this cream. I applied 3 to 4 layers of this stuff and I still felt every needle as if I had applied nothing. I highly do not recommend this product. It's a waste of money! And time.

Body: Let's be clear about one thing. This is not a product developed primarily for Tattoos. This is a numbing agent developed for the Anorectal area. It does work and gives roughly 5-7 hours of relief. Nowhere on the label or directions does this product specify tattoo healing, relief or care.

Author: Khalil Gibran
Title: Contains menthol - burns terribly
Body: I wish I had read the ingredients more closely. In addition to lidocaine, this product contains menthol. If your hemorrhoids are already burning, DO NOT USE THIS product. The menthol makes them and the surrounding tissue burn more. After applying cold compresses to the area to put out the fire, I threw the tube in the trash. Lesson learned.

Title: Got some kind of menthol in it
Body: I don't like extra stuff in the stuff I use. I use this for hemorrhoids and I don't like the tingle of menthol. I found a better product Curist 5% Lidocaine Cream Maximum Strength Topical Pain Relief - 6 oz (170 g) XL Tube at a much better price with no funky additives.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021
Author: Linda E. Wightman
Title: Used to be odorless - why did you change????
Body: First, the formula works great at relieving severe burn/itch and there is no grittiness to the cream like so many other numbing creams.  And I have tried them all for an unrelenting itchy burning rash I permanently have after a case of swimmer's itch.  Base Numb absorbs in and works extremely well.  My biggest complaint is that they have sadly changed the formula - why change something that was working so well?  It used to be a white cream with absolutely no oder.  It was perfect.  I could have it on without anyone else noticing.  Now it smells like ben-gay and has a yellow tint to it - very disappointing.  Please go back to your odorless formula that was so perfect.

Author: J of AT
Title: Too much fragrance, too little relief
Body: This unfortunately does not smell like the ingredients listed and has more of a perfume fragrance. While I did feel numbing on my fingertips after applying for an epilator session, it didn’t do the trick and the relief was very superficial. The product itself says it’s an Anorectal Cream, perhaps it works for that purpose, but not sure it’s helpful for any of the advertised uses. I would try again, but the fragrance is too heavy and hard to get rid of to risk it.

Author: Brittany
Title: worked then it didn't
Body: Now this one may be on me completely, but I initially tried this product on my leg as a test patch for hair removal. It seamed to work just fine and for the most part took away about 90% of the pain.The next time I used it, it did nothing. I used exactly as instructed (except for the wrap) and I could definitely feel everything.I will try again with wrap and even in the shower to open the pores more and hope that helps. Once, I do so then I will update my review.Also, keep in mind every body is different so this just may not have as much effect on me as it would someone else.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Garbage Product
Body: Shortly after applying it has a cool burning sensation that leaves you under the impression that it’s beginning to work. It’s all a rouse, once the needle hits the skin you realize that all the pain is still there and you just purchased a gimmick garbage product. Don’t waste your money or time. Go buy Dr. Numb, it works and it’s worth the money.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2022
Author: Ed
Title: Made in China don't trust
Body: Don't trust this company seems to be copying and using ingredients that can be contamination especially if Lysozyme is open to air can be a problem with its activity from cross contamination

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2022
Author: S.B.A.T.S.
Title: Maybe the formula changed with the packaging?
Body: I use a lot of options for numbing. Whenever I go with this one, the client reports that they still feel it, and within 5-10 minutes is wincing and holding it in - but their skin is already open, so there's little I can do at that point. The transparent gel doesn't seem to be as effective as opaque creams, even wrapped and given a half-hour. It doesn't appear to be as effective as spray either. I noticed they changed the packaging, maybe they've updated the formula too, but it hasn't lived up to its description for me so far.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
Author: Brian Prechtel
Title: Works, but heavily perfumed.
Body: If you have any sensitivity to scents, don't get this. The floral scent is overpowering. It does work, though.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2022
Author: Kyra
Title: It doesn't work and is not worth the money
Body: I am very much upset with what I received. It did come in a decent size squeeze bottle but what does that matter when it doesn't even work. I put on a little to see if my skin would react and it didn't so that was good, but after a few hours nothing happened which made since due to it saying "put a generous amount". After that I put a glob on my skin just like what it said, but after an hour nothing happened. I did this 3 times and still nothing. I'm disappointed.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2021
Author: Do not apply before tattoo
Title: Do not use this product tattooing waste of money read the label it is a Butt cream!!
Body: This was a complete waste of money Amazon sold as a bundle for tattoo numbing should never be applied to your skin if you’re going to get a tattoo read the label. “ Base numb” along with the small lettering Anorectal cream because I didn’t clearly ready it before applying and it made for a terrible session. My tattoo artist did some investigating on the product and why Amazon sells it as a numbing cream for tattooing is incorrect and I even read a couple reviews and trusted the product big lesson learned. The product is butt cream! Do not use on tattoo

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2021
Author: Joelle Arguello
Title: It did not work at all
Body: This product did not perform to my expectations at all I never opened it until Sunday the 18th when I actually needed it and that was the last day I could return it so I’m stuck with product I don’t even need and does not work to my expectations the numbing products in it did not do what I expected it to do and I still had a tattoo session that was just painful without the cream as it was with the cream very disappointed will have to find a new numbing cream for my next tattoo

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2021
Author: Tyler Boyd
Title: No Numbing not even a little
Body: Applied generously an hour prior to tattoo with skin wrapped and only ever felt the minty feeling and never got numb.  My wrist is very disappointed with the lack of numbing prior to the coloring of my tattoo.  May work for some but there is another brand that costs a tad more and ACTUALLY numbs the skin for well over an hour if you apply only 1 hour prior.  Your mileage may vary.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
Author: Megan
Title: Does not relieve tattoo pain
Body: I applied this product as written in directions and as stated in other reviews that used it prior to being tattooed.I applied to my knee (where the tattoo was going), and wrapped it in cling wrap - left that on for about 30 minutes. It just felt like I had put icy-hot on my knee.No difference in pain at all.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021
Author: Concetta Troino
Title: Did not numb in the slighted!
Body: So I tested out the product as you instructed. I put a little bit on a Q-tip, placed it on my nose and on a spot on my face were a Monroe piercing would go, set a timer for 30 minutes and waited. After the alarm went off I poked it with a sewing needle to test out the numbness and it was not numb at all!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021
Author: kelly schlesinger
Title: Worthless
Body: Used as directed day before  as trial,NOTHING! Did not numb,did nothing.Used a thick layer the next day,wrapped it,got to my tattoo appointment,unwrapped it and guess what,NOTHING ONCE AGAIN.I wish I had kept the box to get a refund,this is worst piece of crap I have ever bought,since I have so many tattoos and this was in a painful area I hoped it would work…thanks for the ripoff

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2021
Author: sonda
Title: Be Careful
Body: Having had many tattoos sessions I figure I’ll give it a try not a bit of difference. Major issue with using numbing cream I found out the hard way was it can get in your blood stream and cause major issues I was one of those that had side effects and fainted from it getting in my blood stream. Just be careful and do some research on this and any product that contains Lidocaine.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2022
Author: Victoria
Title: Doesn’t work don’t waste your money
Body: Does not numb at all and scent is unpleasant. If I could give it a 0 I would. Waste of money. I read a lot of the reviews and it was very conflicting but ultimately I learned the hard way the negative reviews were unfortunately correctly. I will be looking into getting a refund

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2021
Author: Hannah
Title: I'm not a xenophobe, but...
Body: I didn't see "Made in China" until after I used it once and went looking for where it was made because it was so utterly ineffective. Nothing against China, but I've seen and read enough about Chinese factories to know that I don't want to put anything made in one of them on my face. Get some Ebanel NUMB520, it's about 520 times better than this.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021
Author: Koty
Title: Did not numb at all.
Body: I purchased this for my first tattoo because I was nervous about it. Put it on two times to see if it would work and no numbing took place. I even left it on one of my fingers to try and see if maybe it was just the area but it was a waste of money.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: DOES NOT WORK - I put on 2 layers and still felt every poke.
Body: DOES NOT WORK - I put on 2 layers and still felt every poke. Ad claims it's goof for tattoos and it does not numb.  I tried 1 layer the first time and 2 layers the 2nd time.  Might as well not used anything.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2022
Author: Jenifer Hoehne
Title: Doesn’t work for esthetics
Body: Used this for microneedling treatments and it didn’t work at all. My clients felt EVERYTHING. Other 5%? Lidocaine topicals work great- this one absolutely doesn’t. I purchased this because my regular topical was out of stock and the reviews were decent. Waste of money!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2022
Author: Idz
Title: Did not work at all. 😐
Body: I tried it to epilate my underarms. Put a lot on (did not rub in), put plastic wrap over it, waited 30 minutes, rinsed, and tried to epilate and did not numb at all. Just feels like a more expensive ICYHOT. Very disappointed.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2022
Author: MaryJo
Title: Doesnt work at all
Body: I am starting to plan out my rib tattoo and I want to find a numbing cream to help. I used it on several parts on my body for smaller tats. It did nothing for me. I felt every sting. Waste of money and time.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021
Author: J G.
Title: waist of money
Body: Put in my ear to test before piercing my daughters ears it says 20 to 30 minutes I applied every 20 minutes for 2 hours and nothing not even numb it .. feels like just normal cream … what a waist of 20 bucks ..

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2022
Author: Rachel
Title: This is Anorectal temporary pain relief.
Body: This is NOT tattoo/PMU numbing cream. This is anoRECTAL cream! For the rector&anus. It literally says it on the bottle. I used it on m microshading client and she was in pain the whole time. Waste of money.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2022
Author: EarthenEyes
Title: Didn't work for me at all.
Body: After one use of slathering on heavy and wrapping in saran for over an hour, basically soaked in it, it did not work. Went right into the garbage. Thankfully it was not a big loss.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2021
Author: Brianna
Title: This ain’t it 😂
Body: I am a heavily tatted person. And I don’t mind the pain. But I got a tattoo in a pretty painful place and I bought this for the pain. It does not work. Doesn’t take the pain away or even ease it. I read the directions and make sure I applied it correctly as well. I don’t recommend

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2022
Author: Ashley
Title: Doesn’t work
Body: I had high hopes for this product. Applied the cream wrapped the area with plastic wrap and let sit for an hour. No numbness detected. I bought this for pain free waxing. I wasted my money.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
Author: Dee
Title: Returned!!
Body: Ive tried numbing creams and this one just didn't suffice. Followed the directions on the product page, which is different from what's on the tube and went in to get my tattoo which i felt every bit of. I guess ill just have to stick to super numb should i need a numbing cream again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2021
Author: kia
Title: Terrible product
Body: I purchased this product with the hopes it would numb the area where I got my tattoo. It did not work at all. I followed the instructions and still felt every part of getting the tattoo. I would not recommend this product to anyone. I wish I could get a full refund

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
Author: Vicki Vogt
Title: Didn't work for me
Body: Tried it twice on my arm just to see the effectiveness and even covered it with saran wrap. (read that it works better that way)  Didn't numb my skin AT all.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2022
Author: keyaira wise
Title: Did not work
Body: It did not work at all i felt everything with my tattoo .Maybe this is just for like regular pain issues but i do not thing its a tattoo numbing cream

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: It doesn’t work
Body: I have tattoos over my whole body and wanted to see if it works and it didn’t. You can still feel the pain trust me. I wouldn’t give it any stars!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2022
Author: Nikki
Title: Does not numb
Body: This product did not work at all. I have tried it multiple times on different areas of the body. No relief from pain for injuries. And no pain relief for waxing. Very disappointed.
